s.text: When she began to look like trouble, she was transferred to the Pentagon.
It will strike many as a demotion devoutly to be wished.

Although conservatives who inveigh against overpaid, do-nothing federal bureaucrats probably have in mind the Department of Health and Human Services, if your urgent need is a government job in general, rather than anything in particular that job might accomplish, apparently the Pentagon is your best shot.
Indeed, Tripp pulls down more than all but a handful of the U.S. military's most senior officers.
Indeed, Tripp pulls down more than all but a handful of the U.S. military's most senior officers.
Federal civilian employees who don't commit felonies and don't cuss out their supervisors pretty much have a guaranteed job with guaranteed wages for life.
Federal civilian employees who don't commit felonies and don't cuss out their supervisors pretty much have a guaranteed job with guaranteed wages for life.
Federal civilian employees who don't commit felonies and don't cuss out their supervisors pretty much have a guaranteed job with guaranteed wages for life.
Federal civilian employees who don't commit felonies and don't cuss out their supervisors pretty much have a guaranteed job with guaranteed wages for life.
And Tripp's pay and retirement benefits are staggering compared with those of the men and women in those hard jobs now.
How much would you have to pay somebody to do a job like that, I asked.
